# wink

## Overview

A banner is a set of crosstabs of survey estimates stitched together,
and with significance testing performed column-by-column within each
crosstab.

``` r
banner(
  data = food,
  var = "pescetarian",
  bys = "age"
)
```

![A banner of pescetarian against age](reference/figures/banner1.png)

A banner of `pescetarian` against `age`

As you add more variables to split by, each new crosstab is added on the
end, without disrupting the significance testing results of previous
ones.

`wink` provides functionality for generating these banners, specific to
each organizationâ€™s unique preferences, before exporting to a common
output format (Excel) for sharing across research teams.

## Installation

You can install the development version of wink from [the GitHub
rep](https://github.com/jjmoncus/wink/) with:

``` r
# library(devtools)
install_github("jjmoncus/wink", 
               build_vignettes = TRUE, # helpful to see vignettes, set to FALSE if needed
               force = TRUE  # helpful if you've installed previous versions, forces an override, set to FALSE if needed
                         )
```

## Usage

See
[`vignette("wink")`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/articles/wink.md)
for an intro to the package, or visit the [Get
Started](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/articles/wink.html) link on the
[website](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/index.html).

For questions, reach out to J.J. Moncus at <jjmoncus706@gmail.com>, or
[raise an issue](https://github.com/jjmoncus/wink/issues).

# Package index

## All functions

- [`banner()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/banner.md) :
  Create banner crosstabs and apply signficance testing across groups

- [`constructor_banner()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/constructor_banner.md)
  :

  Constructor for `wink_banner` class

- [`crosstab()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/crosstab.md)
  : Make a single crosstab

- [`crosstab_builder()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/crosstab_builder.md)
  : Building a crosstab from its inputs

- [`double_or_not()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/double_or_not.md)
  : safely coerce something to a double, or not

- [`fix_guts()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/fix_guts.md)
  : Get the guts of a banner

- [`fix_var_nets()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/fix_var_nets.md)
  : fix var_nets arguments

- [`food`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/food.md) :
  Synthetic Survey Data on Attitudes about Food

- [`hardcode_sig_test()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/hardcode_sig_test.md)
  : hardcoded test for significant differences between two percentages

- [`num_to_excel_col()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/num_to_excel_col.md)
  : Switch between numbers and Excel lettered columns

- [`print(`*`<wink_banner>`*`)`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/print.wink_banner.md)
  : Print method for 'wink_banner' class

- [`sig_test_table()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/sig_test_table.md)
  : Do significance testing on a crosstab

- [`write_banners()`](https://jjmoncus.github.io/wink/reference/write_banners.md)
  : Export banners to a n excel workbook
